682.description: As introduced, requires that vessels used on Tennessee waterways and owned by nonresidents be registered with a certificate of identification number; requires that the proceeds from the registration fees be used for the enforcement of boating regulations and for ensuring that Tennessee waterways are clean. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 9.

683.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Transportation Subcommittee of Transportation Committee
683.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 54, Chapter 21, relative to outdoor advertising.
683.description: As introduced, changes the definition of "visible" in the Outdoor Advertising Control Act of 2020 to "capable of being seen and comprehended without visual aid by a person traveling the posted speed limit on the main traveled way of the highway"; authorizes the commissioner of transportation to issue vegetation control permits to owners of outdoor advertising device permits to remove, block cut, or trim vegetation located on the right-of-way, without regard to whether it is adjacent to the device, if the vegetation prevents clear visibility for a certain distance to occupants of vehicles using the main traveled ways of the controlled systems. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 21.

684.last_action: Placed on cal. Transportation Committee for 3/28/2023
684.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 54 and Title 55, relative to highway safety.
684.description: As introduced, requires the department of transportation to submit reports to the chairs of the transportation committee of the house of representatives and transportation and safety committee of the senate on a five-year plan to increase pedestrian safety and the areas of the state with impassable roads. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

685.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 24; Title 36 and Title 39, relative to a victim advocate's communications.
685.description: As introduced, prohibits disclosure of certain information by an advocate in regard to a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault, stalking, or human trafficking in a judicial, legislative, or administrative proceeding unless the victim gives express written consent. - Amends TCA Title 24; Title 36 and Title 39.

688.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Criminal Justice Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
688.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4, relative to criminal procedure.
688.description: As introduced, requires an officer to provide an alleged victim of certain criminal offenses with a document notifying the victim of the global positioning monitoring system used as a condition of bail. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

690.last_action: Def. to Summer Study in Education Instruction Subcommittee
690.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to high school courses.
690.description: As introduced, requires the board to allow one credit of data science to satisfy one of the mathematics credits required for high school graduation. - Amends TCA Title 49.

692.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Calendar & Rules Committee
692.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8 and Title 50, relative to government employees.
692.description: As introduced, prohibits an appointing authority from entering a government employee's private property or residence without written consent from the employee. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 50.

693.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Public Service Subcommittee of State Government Committee
693.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 45; Title 47 and Title 58, Chapter 2, relative to emergency powers.
693.description: As introduced, prohibits a person, political subdivision, or public official, in connection with a state emergency, from categorizing or proclaiming by order, rule, or regulation that a lawful occupation is non-essential, or otherwise proclaiming by order, rule, or regulation that a lawful occupation is prohibited from operating based on what the lawful occupation is; specifies that a person harmed by a violation of the prohibition may bring a civil action for actual damages or declaratory relief. - Amends TCA Title 45; Title 47 and Title 58, Chapter 2.

694.last_action: H. Placed on Consent Calendar for 3/27/2023
694.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to career and technical education.
694.description: As introduced, establishes the amount of an occupational educator scholarship awarded by the department to prospective educators seeking a Tennessee occupational teaching license as the cost of tuition and mandatory fees at the postsecondary institution attended less all other gift aid, which must be credited first to the eligible prospective educator's tuition and mandatory fees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

695.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee of Criminal Justice Committee
695.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37; Title 40 and Title 41, relative to the Extended Juvenile Jurisdiction Act.
695.description: As introduced, enacts the "Extended Juvenile Jurisdiction Act," which establishes a juvenile justice pilot program in Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 40 and Title 41.

698.last_action: Placed on cal. Local Government Committee for 3/28/2023
698.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 5, Chapter 5 and Title 6, relative to governing bodies of local governments.
698.description: As introduced, prohibits a person in Montgomery, Williamson, Rutherford, Hamilton, Knox, Davidson, or Shelby County from holding office as a county commissioner and as a city council member of a municipality located in whole or in part within such respective county or that shares a coterminous or contiguous boundary with such respective county. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 5 and Title 6.

699.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 55-4-256 and Section 55-4-257, relative to license plates for veterans with disabilities.
699.description: As introduced, increases, from one to two, the number of free plates for the Purple Heart and disabled veteran license plates issued to veterans with disabilities. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-256 and Section 55-4-257.

700.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39 and Title 40, relative to certain sexual offenses.
700.description: As introduced, adds the act of soliciting a minor to engage in conduct that would be statutory rape by an authority figure to the offense of solicitation of a minor; requires a person convicted of continuous sexual abuse of a minor to be sentenced to community supervision for life in addition to any other punishment. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

701.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39 and Title 40, relative to criminal offenses.
701.description: As introduced, increases the penalty to a Class B felony with a fine of up to $100,000 for drug offenses involving 0.5 grams or more of fentanyl, carfentanil, remifentanil, alfentanil, thiafentanil, or any fentanyl derivative or analogue. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

703.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38 and Title 71, relative to the medicaid fraud control division.
703.description: As introduced, expands the duties of the medicaid fraud control unit of the Tennessee bureau of investigation to include investigation of complaints of abuse, neglect and financial exploitation of medicaid recipients in any setting; allows the director of the Tennessee bureau of investigation to create new divisions within the bureau as necessary. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 71.

704.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 40, Chapter 32, relative to the state control number.
704.description: As enacted, requires a court ordering the expunction of a person's public records of a criminal offense as a result of successful completion of a diversion program to include the person's state control number in the expunction order submitted to the Tennessee bureau of investigation. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32.

705.last_action: Placed on cal. Finance, Ways, and Means Committee for 3/28/2023
705.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 8, relative to reemployment after retirement.
705.description: As introduced, extends the authorization for a retired law enforcement officer to be reemployed without loss or suspension of retirement benefits to July 1, 2026; reduces the time that a law enforcement officer must be retired to be reemployed without loss or suspension of retirement benefits from nine months to two months. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 8.

706.last_action: Placed on cal. State Government Committee for 3/29/2023
706.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 24; Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 37; Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 68, Chapter 140, relative to first responders.
706.description: As introduced, authorizes the Tennessee bureau of investigation to electronically file its annual use of force report to the chair of the judiciary committee of the senate and the chair of the criminal justice committee of the house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 24; Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 37; Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 68, Chapter 140.

707.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 41, relative to pay supplements for county correctional officers.
707.description: As introduced, creates a supplemental pay incentive program for county correctional officers who receive 40 hours or more of in-service training per calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 41.

708.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Health Subcommittee of Health Committee
708.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 71, relative to the food stamp program.
708.description: As introduced, requires the department to obtain specific authorization from the general assembly before seeking, applying for, accepting, or renewing a waiver of work requirements established by the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program; prohibits the department from exercising the state's option to provide an exemption from the work requirements; requires the department to assign individuals who are subject to participation conditions to an appropriate employment and training program. - Amends TCA Title 71.

710.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
710.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 5; Title 6 and Title 67, relative to local government taxes and fees.
710.description: As introduced, requires, rather than allows, county legislative bodies to release taxpayers from double taxes if they have been incurred and correct errors in the tax list. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 67.

711.last_action: Rec. for pass; ref to Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
711.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 6 and Title 41, relative to wages and salaries of department of correction employees.
711.description: As introduced, increases wages and salaries of preferred service employees of the department by 15 percent. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 6 and Title 41.

713.last_action: Assigned to s/c Public Service Subcommittee
713.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 56 and Title 71, relative to insurance.
713.description: As introduced, removes obsolete language requiring the commissioner of commerce and insurance to conduct a study of what impediments this state's law may create for insurance for use of justifiable force in this state and to submit a report on the study to the general assembly and governor no later than March 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 56 and Title 71.

714.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Education Administration
714.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49 and Title 71, relative to TANF funds.
714.description: As introduced, authorizes an LEA or public charter school to use TANF program funds to cover costs associated with programs that provide covered services to eligible students; requires the department to consult with the department of human services to determine which programs are eligible to be funded with TANF program funds; requires the department to publish a list of eligible programs on its website. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 71.

715.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
715.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 40, relative to the parole board.
715.description: As introduced, requires the board of parole to publish the board's policy governing attendance at board hearings and submission and use of victim impact statements and other impact statements on the board's website. - Amends TCA Title 40.

716.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Criminal Justice Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
716.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, relative to weapons of mass destruction.
716.description: As introduced, includes fentanyl, carfentanil, remifentanil, alfentanil, thiafentanil, or certain fentanyl derivatives or analogues as a chemical warfare agent when intended for use in a war or other attack to cause disease or death in humans, animals, or plants; categorizes fentanyl as a weapon of mass destruction, thereby making it a Class B felony for any person, without lawful authority, to possess, develop, manufacture, produce, transfer, acquire, weaponize, or retain fentanyl, carfentanil, remifentanil, alfentanil, thiafentanil, or certain fentanyl derivatives or analogues. - Amends TCA Title 39.

718.last_action: Assigned to s/c Public Service Subcommittee
718.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to insurance.
718.description: As introduced, increases, from 15 to 20, the number of days from the date an agency contract is executed or the first insurance application is submitted that an appointing insurer has to file notice with the commissioner of commerce and insurance that the insurer is appointing a producer as its agent. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

719.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Criminal Justice Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
719.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37 and Title 39, relative to juvenile justice.
719.description: As introduced, prohibits interrogation or interview of a child who has been taken into custody due to suspicion that the child committed a delinquent act or unruly conduct except in the presence of the child's legal counsel, parent, guardian, or custodian; requires that a video recording be made of the interview and that the child be informed of certain rights. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 39.

720.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 16; Title 17; Title 18; Title 20; Title 21; Title 24 and Title 28, relative to courts.
720.description: As introduced, authorizes the administrative office of the courts to submit its annual report in an electronic format to the chair of the senate judiciary committee, the chair of the civil justice committee of the house of representatives, and the attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 16; Title 17; Title 18; Title 20; Title 21; Title 24 and Title 28.

723.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 10 and Title 38, Chapter 8, relative to constables.
723.description: As introduced, requires a candidate for the office of constable to undergo a cognitive and psychological examination by a licensed psychologist to ensure the fitness of the candidate prior to running for office. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 10 and Title 38, Chapter 8.

724.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
724.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 20 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21, relative to taxation.
724.description: As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to report, on or before February 1, 2024, to the finance, ways and means committees of the senate and the house of representatives the total annual amount of industrial machinery franchise and excise tax credits provided for fiscal years 2021-2023. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 20 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

725.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3 and Title 4, relative to nullification.
725.description: As introduced, enacts the "Restoring State Sovereignty Through Nullification Act," which establishes processes by which the general assembly may nullify an unconstitutional federal statute, regulation, agency order, or executive order. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 4.

726.last_action: Placed on s/c cal K-12 Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
726.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 68, relative to consent in educational events.
726.description: As introduced, requires a student's parent or legal guardian, or the student if the student has reached the age of majority, to provide a written, informed, and voluntarily signed consent to the student's LEA before the student may receive instruction through the LEA's family life curriculum, participate in a survey, analysis, or evaluation, or receive health services provided through a coordinated school health program. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 68.

727.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Banking & Consumer Affairs Subcommittee of Commerce Committee
727.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 45; Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 56, relative to financial services.
727.description: As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Fair Access to Financial Services Act." - Amends TCA Title 45; Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 56.

728.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63, Chapter 17, Part 1, relative to the practice of speech language pathology.
728.description: As introduced, clarifies the emergency medical backup requirement for speech language pathologists using endoscopes so that the procedure may be performed when a physician is on the premises or is remotely available regardless of whether the procedure is performed in a community or institutional setting. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 17, Part 1.

730.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Civil Justice Committee
730.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 37; Title 38 and Title 39, relative to the department of children's services.
730.description: As introduced, requires the department to remove and destroy certain records of an investigation if the department investigates an individual and closes the case without finding probable cause to believe that a child in the individual's care was dependent and neglected or that the individual committed a criminal violation of title 39. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 37; Title 38 and Title 39.

731.last_action: Action Def. in s/c Elections & Campaign Finance Subcommittee to First Calendar of 2024
731.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, relative to political parties.
731.description: As introduced, prohibits a political party from requiring a person to pay a fee in order to run as that political party's candidate for public office. - Amends TCA Title 2.

732.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
732.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 62 and Title 66, relative to real estate.
732.description: As introduced, requires the Tennessee real estate commission to provide on its website at no cost to users any directory of all brokers and affiliate brokers licensed by the commission if the commission publishes such a directory. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 62 and Title 66.

733.last_action: H. Placed on Consent Calendar for 3/27/2023
733.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 10, Chapter 7, relative to public records.
733.description: As introduced, clarifies that a person requesting public records is not entitled to special or more expeditious access to records under this part due to the person's occupation or association with a specific profession. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

735.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to academic standards for social studies.
735.description: As introduced, changes from urges to requires the standards recommendation committee to include certain academic standards regarding the civil rights movement in the committee's final recommendation of academic standards in the subject of social studies for students in grades nine through 12. - Amends TCA Title 49.

736.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Health Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
736.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 49 and Title 71, relative to the provision of meals to students in after school programs.
736.description: As introduced, requires the department to allocate any temporary assistance for needy families funds remaining unexpended at the end of a fiscal year to eligible after school programs in underserved communities to allow the programs to provide nutritious meals to enrolled students. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49 and Title 71.

737.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Health Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
737.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 56; Title 63 and Title 71, relative to doulas.
737.description: As introduced, requires the department to collaborate with the bureau of TennCare in order to study existing doula certification programs; requires that a report on the study be provided to the members of the general assembly and to the legislative librarian by December 31, 2023. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 56; Title 63 and Title 71.

738.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 13, relative to compensation of charter school staff.
738.description: As introduced, requires the governing body of a public charter school to submit the proposed compensation of a member of its licensed administrative or supervisory staff to its authorizer for approval if the proposed compensation exceeds 150 percent of the average statewide compensation of LEA licensed administrative and supervisory staff according to the position held and training and experience compiled for each school year by the comptroller. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

739.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
739.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8 and Title 49, relative to compensation.
739.description: As introduced, authorizes the director of schools to submit, in an electronic format, to the commissioner of education the director's annual report of the salary rating of each person employed as teacher, principal-teacher, and other school personnel employed on a system-wide basis in the public schools. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.

741.last_action: Assigned to s/c Business & Utilities Subcommittee
741.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, relative to public utilities.
741.description: As introduced, requires municipalities with a population greater than 40,000 to provide water and sewer systems; prohibits such municipalities from entering into contracts for water and sewer systems with other municipalities. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68.

742.last_action: Rec. for pass; ref to Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
742.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 7 and Title 57, relative to retail package stores.
742.description: As introduced, authorizes the issuance of a retail package store license to an operator within the general services district of a metropolitan government that has approved the retail sale of liquor for off-premises consumption by local option election. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 57.

744.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 10, Chapter 7 and Title 49, Chapter 13, relative to charter schools.
744.description: As introduced, enacts the "Transparency in Charter School Finance Act." - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7 and Title 49, Chapter 13.

746.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee for 3/29/2023
746.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 4, relative to the "CEO Pay Disparity Tax Act."
746.description: As introduced, enacts the "CEO Pay Disparity Tax Act," which imposes a pay disparity surcharge in the amount of an additional 0.1 percent to the standard 6.5 percent excise tax rate on each company whose top executive is paid at least 100 times more than the median income of the company's employees. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

747.last_action: P2C, ref. to Government Operations for Review -- Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
747.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, relative to purchases of financial securities.
747.description: As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Tax on Wall Street Act"; imposes a tax equal to 4 percent on all purchases of financial securities made by Tennessee residents; exempts purchases made by retirement accounts and savings plans. - Amends TCA Title 67.

748.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Criminal Justice Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
748.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 21; Title 16, Chapter 20; Title 37, Chapter 11; Title 37, Chapter 5; Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 40, Chapter 24; Title 40, Chapter 14; Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 55, Chapter 10; Title 57, Chapter 5; Title 62, Chapter 38 and Title 67, Chapter 4, relative to youth involved in the justice system.
748.description: As introduced, exempts persons being adjudicated in juvenile court from various fees associated with court proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21; Title 16, Chapter 20; Title 37, Chapter 11; Title 37, Chapter 5; Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 40, Chapter 24; Title 40, Chapter 14; Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 55, Chapter 10; Title 57, Chapter 5; Title 62, Chapter 38 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

749.last_action: H. Placed on Regular Calendar for 3/27/2023
749.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 66, Chapter 27, relative to reserve studies.
749.description: As introduced, requires the board of directors for a unit owners' association to have a reserve study done on or before January 1, 2024, if the board has not had a reserve study conducted on or after January 1, 2023; requires the board to have an updated reserve study done within five years of the date that the reserve study is done, and every five years thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 27.

750.last_action: Assigned to s/c Elections & Campaign Finance Subcommittee
750.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, Chapter 10; Title 3 and Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 5, relative to campaign finances.
750.description: As introduced, authorizes the use of campaign funds for the child care expenditures of a candidate that are incurred by the candidate as a direct result of the candidate's participation in campaign-related events and activities. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10; Title 3 and Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 5.

751.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
751.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37 and Title 39, relative to children.
751.description: As introduced, creates a criminal offense of a foster parent from a kinship placement knowingly allowing a child in the foster parent's care to visit with the child's parent if the foster parent has knowledge of a current court order prohibiting the parent from visiting with the child, with a first violation being a Class C misdemeanor punishable by a fine only and a second or subsequent violation being a Class B misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 39.

752.last_action: Placed on cal. Commerce Committee for 3/28/2023
752.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 7, Chapter 82, relative to insurance coverage for utility district commissioners.
752.description: As introduced, changes a utility district board member's insurance compensation option from payment to reimbursement of payment for premiums paid for equivalent or similar medical insurance coverage and life insurance coverage by the member; allows a utility district board member to receive reimbursement of premiums paid for medical insurance coverage under medicare and any medicare supplement insurance policy. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.

753.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 313 of the Private Acts of 1949; as amended by Chapter 366 of the Private Acts of 1967; Chapter 143 of the Private Acts of 1988; Chapter 1 of the Private Acts of 1991 and Chapter 161 of the Private Acts of 1996; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Road Commission for Hamblen County.
753.description: Subject to local approval, adjusts the compensation of the road commissioners to be $200 or greater, instead of equal to $200 a month; adjusts the compensation of the chairman to be $350 or greater, instead of equal to $350 a month; requires the legislative body of Hamblen County to determine the amount of compensation. - Amends Chapter 313 of the Private Acts of 1949; as amended.

754.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 54, Chapter 17, relative to scenic roadways.
754.description: As introduced, designates the segment of State Route 66 from its intersection with State Route 160 in Hamblen County to its intersection with Interstate 81 at Exit 4 in Jefferson County as a scenic highway. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 17.

755.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 56, relative to insurance.
755.description: As introduced, prohibits, as an unfair claims settlement practice, an auto insurer from directing a body shop to repair a motor vehicle without first providing the insured with written notice of the insured's right to approve the type of body parts to be used in the repair of the motor vehicle and an opportunity to select the type of body parts to be used; specifies that the notice requirement only applies in the five years after the model year of the motor vehicle to be repaired. - Amends TCA Title 56.

757.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 47-18-104, relative to home service contracts.
757.description: As introduced, specifies that it is an unfair or deceptive act to issue or deliver a home service contract to a consumer in this state that does not specify the merchandise and services to be provided, and any applicable limitations, exceptions, or exclusions of the contract. - Amends TCA Section 47-18-104.

759.last_action: Placed on cal. Civil Justice Committee for 3/29/2023
759.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 39-17-1351, relative to military veterans.
759.description: As introduced, waives lifetime enhanced handgun carry permit fees for state residents who are retired veterans of the United States armed forces. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1351.

760.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Banking & Consumer Affairs Subcommittee of Commerce Committee
760.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 47, Chapter 18, relative to devices capable of accessing the internet.
760.description: As introduced, enacts the "Youth Mental Health Safety Act." - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

761.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Insurance Subcommittee of Insurance Committee
761.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 71, relative to payment for adult day care services.
761.description: As introduced, requires the bureau to ensure that providers of adult day care services are reimbursed based upon the amount of services that are authorized on behalf of the eligible adult, and without regard for the eligible adult's attendance or absence at the time the services are scheduled to be provided. - Amends TCA Title 71.

762.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
762.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 18-6-105, relative to duties of county clerks.
762.description: As introduced, removes certain duties of county clerks regarding revenue. - Amends TCA Section 18-6-105.

763.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Criminal Justice Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
763.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38, Chapter 8, relative to law enforcement.
763.description: As introduced, abolishes community oversight boards and authorizes municipalities to create police advisory and review committees to ensure the timely, fair, and objective review of citizen complaints and to make recommendations concerning such complaints. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8.

764.last_action: H. Placed on Regular Calendar for 3/30/2023
764.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 8, relative to the use of off-highway vehicles on state highways and county roads.
764.description: As introduced, requires the department of safety, in consultation with the department of transportation, to prepare a report for the chairs of the transportation committees of the general assembly that details which counties have authorized the use of off-highway vehicles on county roads, the names and lengths of those segments of county roads, and the lengths of state highways and county roads authorized by statute for off-highway vehicle use; requires the report to be delivered by January 15, 2024. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

765.last_action: Placed on cal. Transportation Committee for 3/28/2023
765.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 54 and Title 55, relative to traffic-control signals.
765.description: As introduced, requires the department to promulgate rules to standardize, by speed limit, the length of time a traffic-control signal must display the yellow signal light, when following the green signal light; requires traffic-control signals to be in compliance with the standardized display times. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

766.last_action: Assigned to s/c Public Service Subcommittee
766.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 29 and Title 63, relative to first responders.
766.description: As introduced, adds emergency call takers and public safety dispatchers to the definition of first responder for purposes of death benefits. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 29 and Title 63.

767.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
767.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 7; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40, relative to firearms.
767.description: As introduced, extends from 60 days to 90 days, the time within which a handgun carry permit holder must notify the department of safety in writing of a change in the permit holder's principal place of residence. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

768.last_action: H. Placed on Regular Calendar for 3/27/2023
768.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 55-9-202, relative to mufflers.
768.description: As introduced, clarifies that excessive or unusual noise or annoying smoke can be used to determine whether a muffler is in good working order and in constant operation as required by law. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-202.

773.last_action: H. Placed on Regular Calendar for 3/27/2023
773.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 7 and Title 50, relative to employment.
773.description: As introduced, enacts the "Protecting Tennessee Businesses and Workers Act." - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 50.

774.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
774.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 57, Chapter 3, relative to intoxicating liquors.
774.description: As introduced, requires the Tennessee wine and grape board to submit its annual report on the wine industry and viticulture in this state and on current and future activities of the board to the governor, the commissioner of finance and administration, the chair of the agriculture and natural resources committee of the house of representatives, and the chair of the energy, agriculture and natural resources committee of the senate by February 1 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.

775.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Property & Planning Subcommittee of Local Government Committee
775.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 7, Chapter 40 and Title 7, Chapter 41, relative to the development of retail and other public tourism facilities.
775.description: As introduced, restricts the types of costs of a project within a certified border region retail tourism development district or regional retail tourism development district that can be covered by an apportionment of state sales and use taxes to a municipality or industrial development corporation; makes other revisions to the Border Region Tourism Development District Act and the Regional Retail Tourism Development District Act. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 40 and Title 7, Chapter 41.

776.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55 and Title 68, relative to emergency medical services.
776.description: As introduced, allows the submission of applications for licenses, permits, and certificates by emergency medical services personnel, and applicable fees, before the expiration date of the license, permit, or certificate to extend the license's, permit's or certificate's period up to 65 days, instead of 60 days, to allow administrative processing. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 68.

777.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Population Health Subcommittee of Health Committee
777.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37; Title 39; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to abortion.
777.description: As introduced, limits the offense of criminal abortion to only apply to elective abortions; defines elective abortion as any abortion that is not medically necessary to prevent the death of the pregnant woman or to prevent serious risk of substantial and irreversible impairment of a major bodily function of the pregnant woman. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

778.last_action: Rec. for pass. if am., ref. to Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
778.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to health professions.
778.description: As introduced, requires the board of medical examiners, board of osteopathic examination, board of nursing, and board of physician assistants to, within 45 days of receiving an application for Tennessee licensure from a person who is licensed in another jurisdiction, render a decision on the application and either issue the license or inform the applicant of its decision to deny licensure and the reasons for the denial. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68.

779.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
779.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68 and Title 71, relative to long-term care.
779.description: As introduced, requires the accounting of long-term care expenditures for nursing facility services; home and community-based services made under the CHOICES long-term healthcare program; and employment and Community First CHOICES services under a waiver amendment to the TennCare II demonstration, provided by the bureau of TennCare to the general assembly and interested persons, to include prior fiscal year actual expenditures and projected current fiscal year expenditures no later than January 15 of each year, instead of February 1 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

780.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Local Government Committee
780.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 68-120-101, relative to building construction safety standards.
780.description: As introduced, provides that a resolution adopted by a county or municipal legislative body on or after July 1, 2023, to exempt itself from the statewide building construction standards relative to one-family and two-family dwellings expires 150 days, instead of 180 days, following the date of the election for the local legislative body next occurring following the adoption of the resolution. - Amends TCA Section 68-120-101.

781.last_action: Engrossed; ready for transmission to Sen.
781.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 17, relative to financial literacy education.
781.description: As introduced, requires at least one grade level in each public elementary and middle school to schedule at least five days each school year to highlight age-appropriate financial literacy concepts that include earning income, spending, saving, managing credit, and investing. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 17.

782.last_action: Placed on cal. Education Administration for 3/29/2023
782.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 49, relative to financial aid.
782.description: As introduced, increases, from 90 to 95, the number of days before the date on which the Tennessee student assistance corporation anticipates that it will need to draw funds from the lottery for education accounts that the Tennessee student assistance corporation is required to provide notice to the general assembly, state treasurer, state funding board, and the Tennessee higher education commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 49.

783.last_action: Placed on cal. Education Administration for 3/29/2023
783.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 56, relative to reimbursement of assessment costs.
783.description: As introduced, requires the department of education to establish a fund to reimburse educators in an amount equal to the cost of an assessment required for licensure if the educator receives a qualifying score on the required assessment and receives a license to teach in this state or an endorsement while currently employed by a local education agency or public charter school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 56.

784.last_action: Placed on s/c cal K-12 Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
784.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 49; Title 37, Chapter 5, Part 5; Title 49 and Title 71, Chapter 3, relative to early learning.
784.description: As introduced, requires the department to create and implement a promising futures program to provide scholarships to children who are not school age to assist them in developing early language and literacy skills in a high-quality early care and learning program; redirects, from the lottery for education account to an account administered by the department to provide funding for the promising futures scholarship program, a certain percentage of the privilege tax collected from sports wagering licensees for certain fiscal years. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 49; Title 37, Chapter 5, Part 5; Title 49 and Title 71, Chapter 3.

785.last_action: Placed on cal. Education Administration for 3/29/2023
785.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 5, relative to occupational teaching licenses.
785.description: As introduced, creates a new pathway for honorably discharged veterans to receive an occupational teaching license. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5.

786.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
786.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 67, relative to transportation.
786.description: As introduced, requires a county or municipality to publish its certified highway map on the county or municipality's website, which shall be accessible to the public, no less than 30 days prior to the date of a public hearing on the map. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 67.

787.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
787.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2 and Title 3, relative to campaign finance.
787.description: As introduced, increases from 4 percent to 5 percent, the percentage of general assembly candidates and their committees who will be selected for an audit by the registry. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 3.

788.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 67-6-103, relative to distribution of revenues.
788.description: As introduced, increases, over a five-year period, from 4.6030 percent to 5.0909 percent, the share of state sales and use tax revenue appropriated to municipalities; reduces, over a five-year period, from 29.0141 percent to 28.5262 percent, the share of state sales and use tax revenue deposited to the state general fund. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103.

789.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
789.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39 and Title 40, relative to criminal offenders.
789.description: As introduced, requires the form for use by a lay person petitioning the court for expunction to be made available to the public on the website of the district attorney general for each judicial district. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

790.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49; Title 67 and Title 71, relative to children.
790.description: As introduced, requires the department's office of early learning to include in its annual report on the status of pre-kindergarten programs submitted to the governor and general assembly, the number of open positions for at-risk children in pre-kindergarten programs that remained open for the majority of the immediately preceding school year, or that were filled by children who were not at-risk. - Amends TCA Title 49; Title 67 and Title 71.

791.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee for 3/29/2023
791.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 9; Title 33; Title 37; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to children.
791.description: As introduced, enacts the "First Lady's Children's Trust Fund Act," which creates a trust fund to support persons and entities seeking assistance in the care of children in this state. - Amends TCA Title 9; Title 33; Title 37; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

793.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee for 3/29/2023
793.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 9; Title 39; Title 40; Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4 and Title 69, relative to the electronic monitoring indigency fund.
793.description: As introduced, requires the state treasurer, in consultation with the department of finance and administration, to report on or before February 1, 2024, and on or before February 1 of each subsequent year, to the general assembly on the activities of the electronic monitoring indigency fund for the preceding fiscal year; subjects the fund to examination and audit by the comptroller of the treasury. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 39; Title 40; Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4 and Title 69.

794.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, relative to weapons.
794.description: As introduced, limits the prohibition on a person intentionally, knowingly, or recklessly carrying a weapon on or about the person while inside any building in which judicial proceedings are in progress, by restricting the prohibition to just the rooms in which judicial proceedings are in progress. - Amends TCA Title 39.

795.last_action: Def. to Summer Study in Business & Utilities Subcommittee
795.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Title 62, Chapter 2, Part 4, relative to certificates of registration for engineers.
795.description: As introduced, authorizes graduates of unaccredited engineering technology curriculums to apply for and become registered as engineers, provided that such persons have prior engineering experience and meet certain examination requirements. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 62, Chapter 2, Part 4.

796.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
796.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 69, Chapter 9 and Title 70, relative to wildlife resources.
796.description: As introduced, extends the period within which a nonprofit that partners with TWRA for marketing opportunities must file an annual report of their operation and accomplishments from 90 days after the end of their fiscal year to 100 days after the end of their fiscal year. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 9 and Title 70.

797.last_action: Placed on cal. Commerce Committee for 3/28/2023
797.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 65, Chapter 31, relative to utilities.
797.description: As introduced, increases, from two to three, the minimum number of times the underground utility damage enforcement board is required to meet in a calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 65, Chapter 31.

798.last_action: Engrossed; ready for transmission to Sen.
798.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 13, Chapter 19 and Title 68, Chapter 120, relative to residential and energy codes.
798.description: As introduced, requires that the 2018 International Energy Conservation Code published by the International Code Council be used for the minimum energy conservation standards for new residential construction. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 13, Chapter 19 and Title 68, Chapter 120.

799.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
799.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 12; Title 29; Title 33; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 50; Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to the right to object.
799.description: As introduced, requires that the department of children's services and the department of human services annually report to the judiciary committee of the senate and the children and family affairs subcommittee of the house of representatives the number of objections received to children, health, or human services being provided by religious organizations; the report must identify each objection by county where the objection occurred for the immediately preceding calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 29; Title 33; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 50; Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68.

801.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Business & Utilities Subcommittee for 3/21/2023
801.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 65, Chapter 28 and Title 65, Chapter 31, relative to utility facilities safety enforcement.
801.description: As introduced, changes the frequency with which the underground utility damage enforcement board must meet each calendar year from a minimum of two times to a minimum of three times. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 28 and Title 65, Chapter 31.

802.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2, relative to certified medical assistants.
802.description: As introduced, expands the types of medication a certified medical assistant may administer and prepare as ordered by an authorized healthcare provider. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

804.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 65, Chapter 4, relative to text message solicitations.
804.description: As introduced, extends the prohibitions, requirements, and penalties that apply to telephone solicitations to text message solicitations. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4.

805.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 12, Part 2, relative to criminal offenses.
805.description: As introduced, makes revisions to the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organization (RICO) Act of 1989, including expanding the definition of racketeering activity. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 12, Part 2.

806.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
806.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 7; Title 11; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69 and Title 70, relative to the department of environment and conservation.
806.description: As introduced, requires the department to prepare one of its semiannual permitting efficiency reports containing statistics demonstrating whether the department has acted on permit applications within the time frames established by rule for the governor and general assembly by January 15, instead of February 1. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 11; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69 and Title 70.

807.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37, Chapter 5, Part 5, relative to child care agencies.
807.description: As introduced, states that for the purpose of regulating child care agencies, a nontraditional child care agency does not include a person or entity that places children in family boarding homes or foster homes. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 5, Part 5.

808.last_action: Failed in s/c K-12 Subcommittee of Education Administration
808.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to class sizes.
808.description: As introduced, repeals the maximum class sizes, maximum class size averages, student-teacher ratios, and the prohibition against split-grade classes established by law; authorizes each local education agency (LEA) and public charter school to establish the maximum class sizes for schools under its control and jurisdiction; requires the state board of education, in consultation with the department of education, to develop guidance for LEAs and public charter schools in establishing maximum class sizes. - Amends TCA Title 49.

809.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
809.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5; Title 39; Title 47 and Title 49, relative to protection of digital information.
809.description: As introduced, reduces from 45 days to 30 days, the time within which an information holder must notify a resident of this state, or owner or licensee of the information, of a breach of system security. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5; Title 39; Title 47 and Title 49.

810.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
810.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 7, Chapter 86; Title 10 and Title 38, relative to records.
810.description: As introduced, requires a state agency releasing records that originated in the office of a county assessor to notify the appropriate assessor of property of the records released and the name and address of the person or firm receiving the records within 10 days of releasing the public records, rather than 20 days. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86; Title 10 and Title 38.

811.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
811.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 20, relative to civil procedure.
811.description: As introduced, requires a copy of a submitted complaint to be provided to the applicable licensed court reporter within five calendar days, instead of business days, of receipt by the Tennessee board of court reporting. - Amends TCA Title 20.

812.last_action: Assigned to s/c Cities & Counties Subcommittee
812.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 5 and Title 8, Chapter 8, relative to the enforcement of county resolutions.
812.description: As introduced, requires a sheriff to enforce the resolutions of the county, if the county has expressed by resolution its intent to have the sheriff enforce its resolutions, and the county has filed a certified copy of its resolutions with the sheriff and the general sessions court of the county. - Amends TCA Title 5 and Title 8, Chapter 8.

813.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, Chapter 102, relative to fire safety for mobile food units.
813.description: As introduced, requires the state fire marshal to create a state fire permit that mobile food units may obtain annually to demonstrate fire safety and electrical code compliance to local governments; requires a local government to recognize the state fire permit in its jurisdiction; prohibits the local government from requiring a local fire permit if the mobile food unit holds a state fire permit. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 102.

814.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Insurance Committee
814.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 56 and Title 71, relative to health insurance.
814.description: As introduced, requires certain individual and group health insurance policies to provide coverage of a continuous glucose monitor for a person with diabetes who is insulin-dependent and is covered by the policy. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 56 and Title 71.

815.last_action: Assigned to s/c Elections & Campaign Finance Subcommittee
815.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 2-3-101, relative to polling locations during municipal elections.
815.description: As introduced, authorizes a county election commission to designate a polling place outside of the precinct it is to serve for certain municipal elections only if the polling place serves not more than 50 registered voters of the municipality. - Amends TCA Section 2-3-101.

816.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
816.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2 and Title 6, relative to local elections.
816.description: As introduced, prohibits members of local governing bodies to be elected through an election procedure that requires candidates to be nominated from a district and elected at large. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 6.

817.last_action: H. Placed on Regular Calendar for 3/27/2023
817.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 8, relative to school buses.
817.description: As introduced, decreases from 15 to 14, the number of passengers that a youth bus must be designed to carry in order that a driver of another vehicle commits a Class C misdemeanor for failing to stop upon approaching the bus when stopped to receive or discharge passengers. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

818.last_action: Assigned to s/c Banking & Consumer Affairs Subcommittee
818.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 8-23-203; Title 12 and Title 50, Chapter 2, relative to the minimum wage.
818.description: As introduced, changes, from $7.25 to $12, the minimum hourly wage for employees within the state. - Amends TCA Section 8-23-203; Title 12 and Title 50, Chapter 2.

819.last_action: Placed on cal. Civil Justice Committee for 3/29/2023
819.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 36 and Title 37, relative to child support.
819.description: As introduced, allows a court to temporarily halt a child support obligor's support payments if the support obligor has made an overpayment of child support and to apply the overpayment toward current and future child support obligations until the overpayment is exhausted. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 37.

820.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
820.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 5; Title 6 and Title 68, relative to solid waste.
820.description: As introduced, increases from 15 to 17 the maximum number of members on a solid waste authority board of directors, which are chosen separately from the board for a municipal solid waste region. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 68.

821.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
821.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to higher education.
821.description: As introduced, requires the commission to post a notice on the commission's website within 30 days of designating a degree-granting institution of higher learning as a university. - Amends TCA Title 49.

822.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
822.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 49; Title 58; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to the University of Memphis.
822.description: As introduced, requires the University of Memphis to evaluate the university's educational programs to determine if changes are needed in any of the educational programs and to make the needed changes. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 49; Title 58; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

824.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, relative to motorscooters.
824.description: As introduced, replaces the term "motor-driven cycle" with "motorscooter" for various purposes related to the operation of such vehicles, including issuance of operator licenses, the rules of the road, and required safety and lighting equipment. - Amends TCA Title 55.

826.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Health Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
826.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to beds.
826.description: As introduced, requires the call button to each bed in a general patient area in a nursing home to be easily reachable to, and useable by, a patient. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

827.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee for 3/29/2023
827.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, relative to polling places.
827.description: As introduced, requires the officer of elections at each polling place to post a sign on election day informing voters that it is a Class C misdemeanor to vote in a political party's primary without being a bona fide member of or affiliated with that political party, or to declare allegiance to that party without the intent to affiliate with that party. - Amends TCA Title 2.

828.last_action: Failed in s/c Population Health Subcommittee of Health Committee
828.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 20; Title 39; Title 49; Title 53; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to reproductive health care.
828.description: As introduced, enacts the "Fundamental Right to Reproductive Health Care Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 20; Title 39; Title 49; Title 53; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

829.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 40, relative to bail for certain offenses.
829.description: As introduced, requires a defendant who has been arrested or held to answer for a Class A or Class B felony bailable offense to be admitted to bail only by a judge of the circuit or criminal court rather than by a judicial commissioner, or clerk of a circuit or criminal court. - Amends TCA Title 40.

830.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38, Chapter 6 and Title 40, Chapter 32, relative to expunction.
830.description: As introduced, requires the Tennessee bureau of investigation (TBI) to develop a request for certification form to be completed by the court and submitted to the TBI prior to entering an order of expunction; requires the TBI to determine and certify whether a submitted offense is eligible for expunction; prohibits entry of an order of expunction on or after January 1, 2024, unless a certificate of eligibility from the TBI is attached to the order of expunction. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6 and Title 40, Chapter 32.

831.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Criminal Justice Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
831.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41, relative to criminal offenses.
831.description: As introduced, increases the percentage of restitution for victims of aggravated assault, injured in the scope of their official duties as employees of a penal institution, that will be deducted from the inmate's commissary account from 50 percent to 70 percent. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

832.last_action: Action Def. in s/c Agriculture & Natural Resources Subcommittee to 2024
832.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39; Title 47; Title 55; Title 66; Title 68 and Title 69, Chapter 3, relative to septic systems.
832.description: As introduced, requires an affidavit of affixation for a manufactured home affixed to a parcel of real property to contain a statement that the manufactured home is permanently connected to a functioning septic system, not just a septic system. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 47; Title 55; Title 66; Title 68 and Title 69, Chapter 3.

834.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Elections & Campaign Finance Subcommittee for 3/29/2023
834.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 2-2-106 and Section 2-2-141, relative to election integrity.
834.description: As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections to compare the statewide voter registration database with those of other relevant state agencies and county records when compiling information to distribute to the county elections commissions for purposes of purging voters who have moved; requires the coordinator of elections to compare the statewide voter registration database with the department of safety database to ensure non-United States citizens are not registered to vote in this state. - Amends TCA Section 2-2-106 and Section 2-2-141.

835.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 9; Title 14; Title 29; Title 38; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to public health.
835.description: As introduced, deletes the termination provision for the title addressing the COVID-19 pandemic, which would have terminated July 1, 2023. - Amends TCA Title 9; Title 14; Title 29; Title 38; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68.

837.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
837.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 50, relative to workers' compensation.
837.description: As introduced, changes, from December 31 to December 15, the date by which the bureau of workers' compensation must produce a report listing the name of each covered employer that failed, during the preceding fiscal year, to provide workers' compensation coverage or qualify as a self-insured employer. - Amends TCA Title 50.

838.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to the Wholesome Public School Learning Environment Act.
838.description: As introduced, enacts the "Wholesome Public School Learning Environment Act"; prohibits teachers or other employees of an LEA from discussing sexual preferences or drug use with a student of the LEA during school instruction or a school activity; prohibits an LEA from displaying symbols of drugs or drug paraphernalia on school grounds. - Amends TCA Title 49.

839.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
839.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 14; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to health care.
839.description: As introduced, removes provisions that required health-related boards affected by law relating to prescriptions for Schedule II controlled substances to report to the general assembly by January 1, 2019, on issues related to the implementation of that law. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 14; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

840.last_action: Placed on cal. Criminal Justice Committee for 3/28/2023
840.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 9, relative to obscenity.
840.description: As introduced, removes the educational justification of a person possessing obscene material if the person is at a school building, bus, school campus, grounds, recreational area, athletic field, or other property owned, used, or operated by a local education agency. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 9.

841.last_action: Def. to Summer Study in Agriculture & Natural Resources Subcommittee
841.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 44; Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 53, relative to meat.
841.description: As introduced, specifies that meat may be labeled as being free of mRNA vaccine if the animals from which the meat was derived were not administered an mRNA vaccine; removes authorization for the commissioner of agriculture and the state veterinarian to order vaccination of livestock; specifies that there is no state legal requirement to vaccinate livestock. - Amends TCA Title 44; Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 53.

843.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1, relative to the general assembly.
843.description: As introduced, authorizes each house of the general assembly to appoint a chaplain. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

844.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
844.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2 and Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 2, relative to counties having a charter form of government.
844.description: As introduced, deletes an obsolete provision regarding the deadline for filing nominating petitions for candidates for a charter commission. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 2.

845.last_action: Placed on cal. Commerce Committee for 3/28/2023
845.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 45 and Title 47, Chapter 18, relative to online payment systems.
845.description: As introduced, prohibits an online payment system from freezing the funds of a user without first providing the user with a 90-day written notice of the online payment system's intent to freeze the user's funds; designates a violation as an unfair or deceptive act or practice pursuant to the Tennessee Consumer Protection Act of 1977. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47, Chapter 18.

846.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Cities & Counties Subcommittee of Local Government Committee
846.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 5, relative to the compensation of administrators of elections.
846.description: As introduced, increases the minimum compensation for certified administrators of elections from 90 percent of the compensation of the county assessor of property to 100 percent of the compensation of the county assessor of property. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 5.

848.last_action: Action Def. in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee to 4/5/2023
848.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to education.
848.description: As introduced, enacts the "Rural Schools Innovation Act"; requires the department of education to establish a two-year pilot program for rural districts to partner together to expand access to high-quality, robust college and career pathways. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

849.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
849.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to student assessments.
849.description: As introduced, deletes obsolete language that removed the requirement for Tennessee comprehensive assessment program tests to be administered in the 2019-2020 school year. - Amends TCA Title 49.

852.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 66-6-102, relative to coordinate measurements.
852.description: As introduced, requires that plane coordinate values for a point on the Earth's surface, used to express the geographic position or location of the point, be expressed in international feet instead of United States survey feet. - Amends TCA Section 66-6-102.

853.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
853.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 36, Chapter 1, relative to children.
853.description: As introduced, allows a court to waive or reduce the six-month waiting period after the filing of a petition for adoption under certain circumstances; extends from 45 days to 60 days the time period after birth or surrender or parental consent during which an interested party may pay for certain reasonable, actual expenses of the birth mother; makes various other changes related to adoption and termination of parental rights proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1.

855.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
855.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 56 and Title 71, relative to TennCare.
855.description: As introduced, removes an obsolete reference to a nine-person task force that was assigned to review oversight, utilization, and the future need for ICF/MR services and make recommendations to the general assembly and governor by June 30, 2007. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 56 and Title 71.

856.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
856.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12; Title 54; Title 55; Title 64; Title 65 and Title 67, relative to transportation.
856.description: As introduced, requires a county or municipality to publish its certified highway map on the county's or municipality's website, which must be accessible to the public, no less than 30 days prior to the date of a public hearing on the map. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12; Title 54; Title 55; Title 64; Title 65 and Title 67.

857.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
857.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 54 and Title 55, Chapter 8, relative to highways and roadways.
857.description: As introduced, authorizes the department of transportation to submit its report concerning tolling as an alternative means of funding or financing bridges or highways within the state pursuant to the Tennessee Tollway Act in an electronic format. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55, Chapter 8.

858.last_action: Rec. for pass. if am., ref. to Calendar & Rules Committee
858.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 33 and Title 68, relative to measures to curtail substance abuse.
858.description: As introduced, requires the commissioner, in collaboration with the commissioner of mental health and substance abuse services, to conduct a study of presently available, real-time overdose information databases and mapping tools in use in other jurisdictions to determine whether the statewide use of such system in this state is likely to decrease the occurrence of overdose-related deaths, identify obstacles and challenges to implementing such system statewide, and estimate the costs of and a timeline for implementation, and to deliver a report of findings and recommendations to the general assembly by December 31, 2023. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33 and Title 68.

860.last_action: Placed on s/c cal Criminal Justice Subcommittee for 3/28/2023
860.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4 and Title 43, relative to kratom.
860.description: As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Kratom Consumer Protection Act." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4 and Title 43.

865.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Transportation Subcommittee of Transportation Committee
865.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 39 and Title 54, relative to litter.
865.description: As introduced, expands the rulemaking authority of the commissioner of transportation for purposes of addressing litter prevention and control. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 39 and Title 54.

866.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 57, Chapter 4, relative to the sale of alcoholic beverages on a commercial passenger bus.
866.description: As introduced, authorizes sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages on certain commercial passenger buses. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4.

867.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3, relative to sales and use taxes.
867.description: As introduced, exempts official Tennessee state flags and flags of the United States from the sales and use tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

869.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in State Government Committee
869.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 10, Chapter 7, relative to confidential records.
869.description: As introduced, changes from confidential to a public record the identity of an entity that compounds, distributes, or manufactures the drugs obtained and used by the department of correction to carry out an execution by lethal injection; declares the names of persons involved in carrying out a sentence of death are confidential and exempt from public disclosure. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

871.last_action: Assigned to s/c Civil Justice Subcommittee
871.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 40, Chapter 33, relative to civil asset forfeiture.
871.description: As introduced, adds information to be provided by the department of safety in a report detailing seizures for the previous calendar year and provided to the speakers of the senate and the house of representatives and the chairs of the appropriate committees. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 33.

872.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
872.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to tenure.
872.description: As introduced, requires the board of regents and each state university board to post on their respective websites the tenure policy or policies for faculty at their respective institutions. - Amends TCA Title 49.

873.last_action: Placed on cal. Insurance Committee for 3/28/2023
873.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 56, Chapter 7; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to medical laboratories.
873.description: As introduced, prohibits a health insurance issuer or managed health insurance issuer from denying a licensed medical laboratory the right to participate as a participating provider in any policy, contract, or plan on the same terms and conditions as are offered to another medical laboratory under the policy, contract, or plan; imposes certain other requirements on insurers regarding medical laboratories. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 56, Chapter 7; Title 68 and Title 71.

877.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
877.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 29 and Title 36, relative to solemnization of marriage.
877.description: As introduced, states that a person is not required to solemnize a marriage if the person has an objection to solemnizing the marriage based on the person's conscience or religious beliefs. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 29 and Title 36.

878.last_action: H. Placed on Consent Calendar for 3/27/2023
878.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 13-20-104 and Title 29, Chapter 20, relative to housing authorities.
