1555.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 126 of the Private Acts of 1967; as amended by Chapter 88 of the Private Acts of 1977; Chapter 45 of the Private Acts of 1987; Chapter 216 of the Private Acts of 1988; Chapter 81 of the Private Acts of 1989; Chapter 152 of the Private Acts of 1990; Chapter 73 of the Private Acts of 1991; Chapter 79 of the Private Acts of 2008; Chapter 39 of the Private Acts of 2012; Chapter 22 of the Private Acts of 2017; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the City of Franklin.
1555.description: Subject to local approval, authorizes the vice mayor to vote on all matters when serving as mayor in the temporary absence of the mayor. - Amends Chapter 126 of the Private Acts of 1967; as amended.

1556.last_action: H. Placed on Regular Calendar for 3/27/2023
1556.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 121 of the Private Acts of 2004; as rewritten by Chapter 84 of the Private Acts of 2014; and as amended by Chapter 58 of the Private Acts of 2018 and Chapter 56 of the Private Acts of 2020; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to Ashland City.
1556.description: Subject to local approval, changes the duties of the city recorder; creates the office of city administrator and assigns duties to such office. - Amends Chapter 121 of the Private Acts of 2004; as rewritten.

1557.last_action: Placed on cal. Local Government Committee for 3/28/2023
1557.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 48 of the Private Acts of 1919; as amended and rewritten by Chapter 15 of the Private Acts of 2013; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the City of Niota.
1557.description: Subject to local approval, requires the salary of the mayor and commissioners be set by ordinance in conjunction with the annual budget rather than pursuant to fixed amounts in the charter; removes general supervisory authority of the commissioner of finance and taxation over the city library; removes requirement that the city administrator report directly to the mayor and board of commissioners; removes residency requirement for city administrator. - Amends Chapter 48 of the Private Acts of 1919; as amended and rewritten.

1559.last_action: Placed on cal. Local Government Committee for 3/28/2023
1559.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 187 of the Private Acts of 1945; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the ownership and operation of a non-profit hospital by Blount County, Tennessee.
1559.description: Subject to local approval, alters the conditions under which the county is authorized to own and operate a nonprofit hospital. - Amends Chapter 187 of the Private Acts of 1945.

1560.last_action: P2C, ref. to Local Government Committee
1560.title: AN ACT relative to the use of eminent domain in Sumner County.
1560.description: Subject to local approval, prohibits public entities in Sumner County from using eminent domain to acquire privately owned real property for parks, trails, paths, or greenways for walking, running, hiking, bicycling, or equestrian use, unless the privately owned real property is parallel to, runs directly along the length of, and extends in the same direction as a highway, road, or street,

1561.last_action: Placed on cal. Local Government Committee for 3/28/2023
1561.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 272 of the Acts of 1901; as amended and rewritten by Chapter 115 of the Private Acts of 2006; as amended by Chapter 13 of the Private Acts of 2015 and Chapter 42 of the Private Acts of 2022; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Town of Petersburg.
1561.description: Subject to local approval, makes changes to the duties of the mayor; reduces the term of the mayor and vice mayor from two years to four; provides a method to fill vacancies on the board if the vacancies cause the board to lack a quorum; authorizes the board to set the salary of the board members by ordinance; revises the powers of the city; authorizes the appointment of a treasurer and town administrator; requires the town judge to be a licensed attorney. - Amends Chapter 272 of the Acts of 1901; as amended and rewritten.

1562.last_action: Placed on cal. Local Government Committee for 3/28/2023
1562.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 26 of the Private Acts of 2007; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Maury County Sheriff's Department.
1562.description: Subject to local approval, requires the civil service board to meet semi annually rather then annually; designates the county mayor as the board secretary, to replace the county human resources director; removes board authority to hold performance examinations to determine qualifications for employment; deletes competitive promotion examination requirements; provides for a right of appeals upon a suspension of an employee by the sheriff. - Amends Chapter 26 of the Private Acts of 2007.

1564.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 486 of the Private Acts of 1941; as amended and rewritten by Chapter 26 of the Private Acts of 2013; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Charter of the City of Smithville.
1564.description: As introduced, subject to local approval, removes prohibition on persons convicted of malfeasance or misfeasance in office, felonies, or crimes involving moral turpitude from being an employee of the city for ten years after the conviction; reduces, from a 2/3 majority to a simple majority, the required vote by the council for approving and removing mayoral appointments; authorizes the city board to appoint and promote city employees. - Amends Chapter 486 of the Private Acts of 1941; as amended and rewritten.

1565.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 167 of the Private Acts of 1994; as amended by Chapter 39 of the Private Acts of 2020 and Chapter 52 of the Private Acts of 2022; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter of the Town of Oakland.
1565.description: Subject to local approval, authorizes the town to impose fees on the development of land to pay for capital improvement; authorizes the board of mayor and aldermen to appoint and remove all directors and department heads, upon majority vote; and replaces the town manager with the board as the appointing authority for the town recorder. - Amends Chapter 167 of the Private Acts of 1994; as amended.

1566.title: AN ACT relative to the jurisdiction of courts in Overton County.
1566.description: Subject to local approval, establishes that juvenile court has concurrent jurisdiction with chancery and circuit courts relating to cases of adoption, pursuant to general law.

1567.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 429 of the Private Acts of 1931; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Murfreesboro Solid Waste Authority.
1567.description: Subject to local approval, authorizes the creation of a solid waste authority; authorizes the authority to issue bonds. - Amends Chapter 429 of the Private Acts of 1931.

1568.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 202 of the Private Acts of 1984; as amended by Chapter 211 of the Private Acts of 1992; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to Obion County.
1568.description: Subject to local approval, repeals the Obion County Highway Commission in 2026. - Amends Chapter 202 of the Private Acts of 1984; as amended.

1744.title: A RESOLUTION to propose an amendment to Article II, Section 31 of the Constitution of Tennessee, to allow the investment of state funds in equities.
1744.description: Proposes an amendment to Article II, Section 31 of the Constitution of Tennessee authorizing the governing body or state official charged with carrying out the purpose or objectives of a fund or trust that is administered or invested by the Treasury and that contains state funds, in whole or in part, to adopt, with approval of the Treasurer and the Comptroller of the Treasury, an investment policy to authorize all or part of such fund or trust to be invested such that the state would become an owner, in whole or in part, of any bank or a stockholder with others in any association, company, or corporation.

2094.last_action: Refer to Senate Health & Welfare Committee
2094.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 9-8-307; Title 14; Title 29, Chapter 20; Section 49-7-159 and Chapter 896 of the Public Acts of 2022, relative to COVID-19.
2094.description: As introduced, makes permanent limitations on claims against a person for loss, damage, injury, or death arising from COVID-19 and the prohibition on COVID-19 vaccine mandates. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-307; Title 14; Title 29, Chapter 20; Section 49-7-159 and Chapter 896 of the Public Acts of 2022.

2098.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3, Chapter 2; Title 8, Chapter 31 and Title 8, Chapter 6, relative to nepotism.
2098.description: As introduced, requires the attorney general and reporter to investigate reports of violations of the Tennessee State Employees Uniform Nepotism Policy Act of 1980 within the judicial branch; authorizes the attorney general to levy a civil penalty for violations; creates a Class A misdemeanor for continuing violations. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2; Title 8, Chapter 31 and Title 8, Chapter 6.

2101.last_action: Refer to Senate State & Local Government Committee
2101.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 10 and Title 38, relative to records.
2101.description: As introduced, states that medical records, law enforcement investigative reports, 911 call recordings, photographs, and any other recordings related to a death are not public records if the investigating law enforcement agency determines that the death was not the result of a crime; makes confidential any body camera footage that includes the interior of a private residence recorded due to investigation of a death, which the law enforcement agency determined not to be the result of a crime. - Amends TCA Title 10 and Title 38.

2176.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3, relative to commercial driver licenses.
2176.description: As introduced, establishes that a commercial driver license issued with a hazardous materials endorsement expires on the date the hazardous materials endorsement authorization expires. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.

2202.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, relative to assault.
2202.description: As introduced, increases the penalty for assault committed against an official in a youth sporting event from a Class A or B misdemeanor to a Class E felony; defines "official in a youth sporting event" as a person, either paid or volunteering, who is acting as a referee, umpire, or other official at an event in which minors or elementary, secondary, or post-secondary students are competing in an athletic activity. - Amends TCA Title 39.

2213.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 5; Title 6 and Title 67, Chapter 5, relative to property tax exemptions.
2213.description: As introduced, creates tax exemption for portions of property that provide tree canopy cover in certain counties, subject to the approval of the local governing body in such counties. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

2272.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
2272.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 56 and Title 66, relative to automobiles.
2272.description: As introduced, requires an insurer or insured individual to remove an automobile deemed a total loss from a repair facility's property within five business days of the date upon which the automobile is deemed a total loss; specifies additional requirements and penalties related to the requirement. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 66.

2279.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
2279.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, Chapter 5, relative to doulas.
2279.description: As introduced, enacts the "Maternal and Infant Mortality Prevention Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, Chapter 5.

2318.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 7, Chapter 51, Part 2 and Title 8, relative to law enforcement officers.
2318.description: As introduced, entitles a POST-certified law enforcement officer to a presumption of disability if the officer suffers a condition or impairment of health caused by the contraction of an infectious disease in the line of duty and such condition or impairment results in total or partial disability; applies retroactively from January 1, 2021. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51, Part 2 and Title 8.

2398.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
2398.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 20; Title 27; Title 28 and Title 29, relative to torts.
2398.description: As introduced, requires, in order to recover for any tort, whether established at common law or by statute, a person to prove the claim by clear and convincing evidence; applies to actions, excluding workers' compensation claims, accruing on or after July 1, 2023. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 27; Title 28 and Title 29.

2832.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Judiciary Committee
2832.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8 and Title 38, relative to law enforcement.
2832.description: As introduced, requires the Tennessee peace officer standards and training commission to submit the curriculum requirements concerning the use of citations in lieu of arrest, domestic violence training, and proper procedures to respond to persons with mental illnesses by February 1, 2024, to the chair of the senate judiciary committee and the chair of the criminal justice committee of the house of representatives; requires the commission to also submit any proposed amendments to those requirements to the same chairs at least 60 days prior to the amendments being implemented. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 38.

2834.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
2834.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 50, relative to sex discrimination.
2834.description: As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Pay Equality Act" to revise present law concerning sex-based discrimination in compensation for employment. - Amends TCA Title 50.

3022.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
3022.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9; Title 13; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68, relative to utilities.
3022.description: As introduced, increases, from five to six, the number of years for which the utility management review board is permitted to recommend terms of no interest for a loan for an applicant through the utility relocation program. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9; Title 13; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68.

3031.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
3031.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3; Title 4; Title 8 and Title 9, relative to the impact of legislation on certain demographic groups.
3031.description: As introduced, authorizes, under certain circumstances, a member of the general assembly or sponsor of a bill, amendment, or resolution to request by email that the fiscal review committee include a Tennessee racial impact statement in the fiscal note analyzing the effect of the measure on demographic groups. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8 and Title 9.

3143.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
3143.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37; Title 39; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to pregnancy.
3143.description: As introduced, permits the department to electronically deliver the data related to complications of induced abortions, which is included in the department's annual report of selected induced termination of pregnancy data. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39; Title 63 and Title 68.

3180.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Title 7, relative to public works.
3180.description: As introduced, expands application of the $250,000 annuity given to the estate of any emergency responder killed in the line of duty to include public works employees within the department whose duties include emergency response. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 7.

3277.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
3277.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29; Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 4 and Title 66, relative to mobile homes.
3277.description: As introduced, requires a mobile home lot owner to provide notice to the lender of financing for the mobile home of a pending eviction; authorizes the mobile home lot owner to seek payment of rent for the mobile home if the lender does not move it within 10 days of the eviction; makes other related changes. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 4 and Title 66.

3372.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
3372.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8 and Title 16, relative to the compensation of public officers and employees.
3372.description: As introduced, entitles criminal investigators to be compensated at a rate equal to 35 percent of the annual compensation of the district attorney general, with compensation rate increases for 20 years until the compensation rate equals 55 percent of the annual compensation of the district attorney general. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 16.

3568.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 16; Title 24; Title 33; Title 34; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to children.
3568.description: As introduced, changes, from March 1 to March 15 of each year, the date by which the department is required to appear before the judiciary committee of the senate and the civil justice committee of the house of representatives to review the department's policies, protocols, procedures, and any other provisions that affect the children served by the department. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 16; Title 24; Title 33; Title 34; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 68 and Title 71.
